verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Depart, and go up hence, thou and the people which thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt, unto the land which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it:
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Leave this place and travel — you and the people you brought out of Egypt — to the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, 'I will give it to your descendants.'

verses.kjv: And I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
verses.ct: I will send an angel ahead of you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.

verses.kjv: Unto a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked people: lest I consume thee in the way.
verses.ct: Go to that land rich with milk and honey. But I will not travel among you, because you are a stubborn people, and I might destroy you along the way."

verses.kjv: And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and no man did put on him his ornaments.
verses.ct: When the people heard this devastating news, they grieved, and no one put on any jewelry or ornaments.

verses.kjv: For the LORD had said unto Moses, Say unto the children of Israel, Ye are a stiffnecked people: I will come up into the midst of thee in a moment, and consume thee: therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee, that I may know what to do unto thee.
verses.ct: The LORD had told Moses, "Tell the Israelites: 'You are a stubborn people. If I were to come among you for even a moment, I would destroy you. So take off your ornaments now, and I will decide what to do with you.'"

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments by the mount Horeb.
verses.ct: So the Israelites removed their ornaments at Mount Horeb.

verses.kjv: And Moses took the tabernacle, and pitched it without the camp, afar off from the camp, and called it the Tabernacle of the congregation. And it came to pass, that every one which sought the LORD went out unto the tabernacle of the congregation, which was without the camp.
verses.ct: Moses would take the tent and set it up outside the camp, at a distance from it, and he called it the Tent of Meeting. Anyone who wanted to seek the LORD would go out to the Tent of Meeting outside the camp.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses went out unto the tabernacle, that all the people rose up, and stood every man at his tent door, and looked after Moses, until he was gone into the tabernacle.
verses.ct: Whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people would stand up, each one at the entrance of their own tent, and watch Moses until he went inside.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as Moses entered into the tabernacle, the cloudy pillar descended, and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and the Lord talked with Moses.
verses.ct: As Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and stand at the entrance of the tent while the LORD spoke with Moses.

verses.kjv: And all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand at the tabernacle door: and all the people rose up and worshipped, every man in his tent door.
verses.ct: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the tent's entrance, they would all stand and worship, each at the entrance of their own tent.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend. And he turned again into the camp: but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, departed not out of the tabernacle.
verses.ct: The LORD would speak to Moses directly, the way someone talks to a friend. Then Moses would return to the camp, but his assistant Joshua son of Nun, a young man, would not leave the tent.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, See, thou sayest unto me, Bring up this people: and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with me. Yet thou hast said, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.
verses.ct: Moses said to the LORD, "You keep telling me, 'Lead these people,' but you haven't told me who you're sending with me. Yet you've said, 'I know you by name, and you have found grace with me.'"

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thy sight, shew me now thy way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in thy sight: and consider that this nation is thy people.
verses.ct: "So please, if I truly have found grace with you, show me your ways so I can know you and continue to find grace with you. And remember that this nation is your people."

verses.kjv: And he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, If thy presence go not with me, carry us not up hence.
verses.ct: Moses said to him, "If your presence isn't going with us, don't send us from this place.

verses.kjv: For wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight? is it not in that thou goest with us? so shall we be separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth.
verses.ct: How will anyone know that I and your people have found grace with you unless you go with us? That is what will set us apart — me and your people — from every other nation on the earth."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, I will do this thing also that thou hast spoken: for thou hast found grace in my sight, and I know thee by name.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "I will do exactly what you've asked, because you have found grace with me, and I know you by name."

verses.kjv: And he said, I beseech thee, shew me thy glory.
verses.ct: Then Moses said, "Please, show me your glory."

verses.kjv: And he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and I will proclaim the name of the LORD before thee; and will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will shew mercy on whom I will shew mercy.
verses.ct: The LORD answered, "I will cause all my goodness to pass in front of you, and I will announce my name — the LORD — in your presence. I will show grace to whoever I choose to show grace, and I will show mercy to whoever I choose to show mercy."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man see me, and live.
verses.ct: But he added, "You cannot see my face, because no human can see me and survive."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon a rock:
verses.ct: Then the LORD said, "Look, there is a spot near me where you can stand on a rock.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a clift of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:
verses.ct: When my glory passes by, I will place you in a gap in the rock and shield you with my hand as I pass.

verses.kjv: And I will take away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
verses.ct: Then I will remove my hand, and you will see my back — but my face must not be seen."
